intro: Fleischmannia klattiana, commonly known as the Klattian flame tree, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is native to South America. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a smooth texture. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in warm, sunny environments with well-drained soil. Fleischmannia klattiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
